quiz.text:
Choose the incorrect statement regarding recently launched RBI's Integrated Ombudsman Scheme?
हाल ही में शुरू की गई RBI की एकीकृत लोकपाल योजना के संबंध में गलत कथन चुनिए?
options:
(A) The Integrated Ombudsman Scheme was launched by Reserve Bank of India in November 2021.
(A) भारतीय रिजर्व बैंक द्वारा नवंबर 2021 में एकीकृत लोकपाल योजना शुरू की गई थी।

(B) The scheme is launched for Non-Banking Financial Company(NBFC), banks and pre-paid instrument players.
(B) यह योजना गैर-बैंकिंग वित्तीय कंपनी (NBFC), बैंकों और प्रीपेड इंस्ट्रूमेंट प्लेयर्स के लिए शुरू की गई है।

(C) The scheme will amalgamate banking ombudsman scheme 2006, NBFC ombudsman scheme 2018 and Ombudsman scheme of digital transactions 2019.
(C) यह योजना बैंकिंग लोकपाल योजना 2006, NBFC लोकपाल योजना 2018 और डिजिटल लेनदेन 2019 की लोकपाल योजना को मिला देगी।

(D) The first centralized jurisdiction neutral receipt and processing center is set up in New Delhi.
(D) पहला केंद्रीकृत क्षेत्राधिकार तटस्थ रसीद और प्रसंस्करण केंद्र नई दिल्ली में स्थापित किया गया है।

(E) The executive director of Consumer Education and Protection Department of RBI will be the appellate authority under the integrated scheme. 
(E) एकीकृत योजना के तहत भारतीय रिजर्व बैंक के उपभोक्ता शिक्षा एवं संरक्षण विभाग के कार्यकारी निदेशक अपीलीय प्राधिकारी होंगे।
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is The first centralized jurisdiction neutral receipt and processing center is set up in New Delhi.

Key Points

  • The RBI Integrated Ombudsman Scheme was launched by PM Narendra Modi in November 2021.
  • The RBI Integrated Ombudsman Scheme amalgamates :
  1. Banking Ombudsman Scheme 2006
  2. Non-Banking Financial Company Ombudsman Scheme 2018
  3. Digital Transactions Ombudsman Scheme 2019
  • The RBI Integrated Ombudsman Scheme will be applied to:
  1. Banks
  2. Non-Banking Financial Company
  3. Pre-paid instrument player
  4. Non-Scheduled primary cooperative Bank with deposit size 50 crore or above
  • Through the RBI Integrated Ombudsman Scheme customers can:
  1. File Complaints
  2. Submit Documents
  3. Track Status 
  4. Give Feedback
  • A single email address and multilingual toll-free number will be provided under the One Nation One Ombudsman initiative.
  • RBI Director in charge of Consumer Education & Protection Department will be the appellate authority of the Integrated Ombudsman Scheme.
  • The first centralized jurisdiction neutral receipt and processing center is set up in Chandigarh.

Additional Information

  • Ombudsman is a government official who deals with complaints of normal people against a public organization.
  • Ombudsman is currently deployed in three sectors in India:
  1. Insurance Sector
  2. Income Tax Sector
  3. Banking Sector
  • The concept of the Ombudsman is taken from Sweden.


सही उत्तर है पहला केंद्रीकृत क्षेत्राधिकार तटस्थ रसीद और प्रसंस्करण केंद्र नई दिल्ली में स्थापित किया गया है।

Key Points 

  • RBI एकीकृत लोकपाल योजना नवंबर 2021 में पीएम नरेंद्र मोदी द्वारा शुरू की गई थी।
  • RBI एकीकृत लोकपाल योजना समामेलित:
  1. बैंकिंग लोकपाल योजना 2006
  2. गैर-बैंकिंग वित्तीय कंपनी लोकपाल योजना 2018
  3. डिजिटल लेनदेन लोकपाल योजना 2019
  • RBI एकीकृत लोकपाल योजना निम्न के लिए लागू होगी:
  1. बैंकों
  2. गैर-बैंकिंग वित्तीय कंपनी
  3. प्रीपेड इंस्ट्रूमेंट प्लेयर
  4. 50 करोड़ या उससे अधिक जमा राशि वाले गैर-अनुसूचित प्राथमिक सहकारी बैंक
  • भारतीय रिजर्व बैंक एकीकृत लोकपाल योजना के माध्यम से ग्राहक कर सकते हैं:
  1. शिकायत दर्ज करना
  2. दस्तावेज़ जमा करना
  3. स्थिति ट्रैक करना
  4. प्रतिक्रिया देना
  • वन नेशन वन ओम्बड्समैन पहल के तहत एक ईमेल पता और बहुभाषी टोल-फ्री नंबर प्रदान किया जाएगा।
  • उपभोक्ता शिक्षा और संरक्षण विभाग के प्रभारी RBI निदेशक एकीकृत लोकपाल योजना के अपीलीय प्राधिकारी होंगे।
  • पहला केंद्रीकृत क्षेत्राधिकार तटस्थ रसीद और प्रसंस्करण केंद्र चंडीगढ़ में स्थापित किया गया है।

Additional Information 

  • लोकपाल एक सरकारी अधिकारी होता है जो एक सार्वजनिक संगठन के खिलाफ सामान्य लोगों की शिकायतों से निपटता है।
  • लोकपाल वर्तमान में भारत में तीन क्षेत्रों में तैनात है:
  1. बीमा क्षेत्र
  2. आयकर क्षेत्र
  3. बैंकिंग क्षेत्र
  • लोकपाल की अवधारणा स्वीडन से ली गई है।

quiz.text:
Bharti Airtel successfully conducted India’s first 5G trial in the 700 MHz band in partnership with which of the following in November 2021?
भारती एयरटेल ने नवंबर 2021 में निम्नलिखित में से किसके साथ साझेदारी में 700 मेगाहर्ट्ज बैंड में भारत का पहला 5G परीक्षण सफलतापूर्वक किया?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Nokia.

Key Points

  • Bharti Airtel successfully conducted India’s first 5G trial in the 700 MHz band in partnership with Nokia in November 2021.
  • It was conducted on the outskirts of Kolkata and it was also the first 5G trial in Eastern India.
  • Airtel and Nokia were able to achieve high-speed wireless broadband network coverage of 40 Km between two 3GPP standard 5G sites in real-life conditions. 

Important Points

  • ​Airtel has been allotted test spectrum in multiple bands by the Department of Telecommunications for the validation of 5G technology and uses cases.

  • Airtel used equipment from Nokia’s 5G portfolio, which included NokiaAirScale radios and standalone (SA) core. 



सही उत्तर नोकिया है।

Key Points

  • भारती एयरटेल ने नवंबर 2021 में नोकिया के साथ साझेदारी में 700 मेगाहर्ट्ज बैंड में भारत का पहला 5G परीक्षण सफलतापूर्वक किया।
  • यह कोलकाता के बाहरी इलाके में आयोजित किया गया था और यह पूर्वी भारत में पहला 5G परीक्षण भी था।
  • एयरटेल और नोकिया वास्तविक जीवन की परिस्थितियों में दो 3GPP मानक 5G साइटों के बीच 40 किलोमीटर की उच्च गति वायरलेस ब्रॉडबैंड नेटवर्क कवरेज हासिल करने में सक्षम थे।

Important Points

  • एयरटेल को दूरसंचार विभाग द्वारा 5G प्रौद्योगिकी और उपयोग के मामलों के सत्यापन के लिए कई बैंडों में परीक्षण स्पेक्ट्रम आवंटित किया गया है।
  • एयरटेल ने नोकिया के 5G पोर्टफोलियो के उपकरणों का इस्तेमाल किया, जिसमें नोकियाएयरस्केल रेडियो और स्टैंडअलोन (SA) कोर शामिल थे।​

quiz.text:
According to a report which cited the latest census data, the median family earnings of Indians in the US is how many USD?
नवीनतम जनगणना के आंकड़ों का हवाला देते हुए एक रिपोर्ट के अनुसार, अमेरिका में भारतीयों की औसत पारिवारिक आय कितने अमेरिकी डॉलर है?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 123,700.

  • Indians in the US have surpassed the overall American population in terms of wealth and college education, according to a report which cited the latest census data.
  • The median family earnings of Indians in the US is USD 123,700, nearly double the nationwide average of USD 63,922.
  • The number of people who identify as Asian in the United States nearly tripled in the past three decades, and Asians are now the fastest-growing of the nation's four largest racial and ethnic groups, according to a New York Times analysis of the census data.
  • Indians are ahead of other Asian groups in the US in median family earnings ranges.
  • Taiwanese and Filipinos with USD 97,129 and USD 95,000 of median family incomes respectively are in second and third place.
  • About 4 million Indians currently reside in the US, including 1.6 million visa holders, 1.4 million naturalised residents and a million are US-born residents.
  • About 79 per cent of Indians are college graduates, in comparison with the nationwide average of 34 per cent, according to the report.


सही उत्तर 123,700 है।

  • नवीनतम जनगणना के आंकड़ों का हवाला देते हुए एक रिपोर्ट के अनुसार, अमेरिका में भारतीयों ने धन और कॉलेज शिक्षा के मामले में कुल अमेरिकी आबादी को पीछे छोड़ दिया है।
  • अमेरिका में भारतीयों की औसत पारिवारिक आय 123,700 अमेरिकी डॉलर है, जो राष्ट्रव्यापी औसत 63,922 अमेरिकी डॉलर से लगभग दोगुना है।
  • न्यू यॉर्क टाइम्स द्वारा जनगणना के आंकड़ों के विश्लेषण के अनुसार, संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिका में एशियाई के रूप में पहचान करने वाले लोगों की संख्या पिछले तीन दशकों में लगभग तीन गुना हो गई है, और एशियाई अब देश के चार सबसे बड़े नस्लीय और जातीय समूहों में सबसे तेजी से बढ़ रहे हैं।
  • औसत पारिवारिक आय वर्ग में भारतीय अमेरिका में अन्य एशियाई समूहों से आगे हैं।
  • ताइवानी और फिलिपिनो क्रमशः 97,129 अमरीकी डालर और 95,000 अमरीकी डालर की औसत पारिवारिक आय के साथ दूसरे और तीसरे स्थान पर हैं।
  • वर्तमान में लगभग 4 मिलियन भारतीय अमेरिका में रहते हैं, जिनमें 16 लाख वीजा धारक, 14 लाख प्राकृतिक निवासी और दस लाख अमेरिकी मूल के निवासी हैं।
  • रिपोर्ट के मुताबिक, देश भर में औसतन 34 फीसदी की तुलना में करीब 79 प्रतिशत भारतीय कॉलेज ग्रेजुएट हैं।

quiz.text:
SAMADHAAN portal has been launched by which ministry?


SAMADHAAN पोर्टल किस मंत्रालय द्वारा शुरू किया गया है?
options:
(A) Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
(A) सूक्ष्म, लघु और मध्यम उद्यम

(D) Labour and Employment
(D) श्रम और रोजगार

(E) Science and Technology
(E) विज्ञान और तकनीक
quiz.solution:
Shri Giriraj Singh launched MSME Delayed Payment Portal – MSME Samadhaan (http://msefc.msme.gov.in). It will empower micro and small entrepreneurs across the country to directly register their cases relating to delayed payments. The Portal will give information about the pending payment of MSEs with individual CPSEs / Central Ministries, State Governments, etc.

श्री गिरिराज सिंह ने MSME विलंबित भुगतान पोर्टल - MSME समाधन (http://msefc.msme.gov.in) का शुभारंभ किया| यह देश भर के सूक्ष्म और लघु उद्यमियों को विलंबित भुगतानों से संबंधित मामलों को सीधे पंजीकृत करने के लिए सशक्त करेगा| पोर्टल, व्यक्तिगत CPSE/ केंद्रीय मंत्रालयों, राज्य सरकारों आदि के साथ MSE के लंबित भुगतान के बारे में जानकारी देगा|

quiz.text:
Reserve Bank of India has recently conducted a consumer confidence survey. Which of the following statement is TRUE in regard to the survey?

Statement 1: The current situation index fell to 53.1 in March from 55.5 in January, according to the Reserve Bank of India’s consumer confidence survey

Statement 2: Income and prices and the current situation index had hit a record low of 49.9 in September


भारतीय रिजर्व बैंक ने हाल ही में एक उपभोक्ता विश्वास सर्वेक्षण किया है। सर्वेक्षण के संबंध में निम्नलिखित में से कौन सा कथन सत्य है?

कथन 1: भारतीय रिजर्व बैंक के उपभोक्ता विश्वास सर्वेक्षण के अनुसार, वर्तमान स्थिति सूचकांक जनवरी में 55.5 से गिरकर मार्च में 53.1 हो गया

कथन 2: आय और कीमतें और वर्तमान स्थिति सूचकांक सितंबर में 49.9 के रिकॉर्ड निचले स्तर पर पहुंच गया था
options:
(D) None of the above
(D) उपरोक्त में से कोई नहीं
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is option 1) which is Both 1 and 2

Solution: The current situation index fell to 53.1 in March from 55.5 in January as well as income and prices and the current situation index had hit a record low of 49.9 in September according to the Reserve Bank of India’s consumer confidence survey.

Notes:

  • As per Indian consumers turned more pessimistic about the present and less gung-ho about the future, making them less likely to spend big in an economy that’s driven by domestic consumption.
  • The current situation index fell to 53.1 in March from 55.5 in January, according to the Reserve Bank of India’s consumer confidence survey, where 100 is the dividing line between pessimism and optimism.
  • Survey respondents were also less optimistic about the year ahead, with the future expectations index dipping to 108.8 from 117.1 in the period under review.
  • The reasons for the pessimism were deteriorating sentiments on the general economic situation, income, and prices and the current situation index had hit a record low of 49.9 in September.
  • The well-entrenched inflation expectations, which are an added challenge for monetary policymakers who were forced to pause interest rate cuts last year because of gains in price growth.
  • Households’ median inflation perception for the current period as well as for the three months ahead increased by 50 basis points to 8.7% and by 80 bps to 10.1%, respectively, compared to the January 2021 survey
  • Median inflation expectations for one year ahead also remained at an elevated level.
  • Elevated inflation and negative real rates can create their own distortions such as encouraging investment in physical assets such as gold, which in turn can pressure external balances through high gold imports and lower potential growth via lower financial savings.


सही उत्तर विकल्प 1) है जो 1 और 2 दोनों है। 

हल: भारतीय रिजर्व बैंक के उपभोक्ता विश्वास सर्वेक्षण के अनुसार वर्तमान स्थिति सूचकांक मार्च में 55.5 से गिरकर जनवरी में 55.5 के साथ-साथ आय और कीमतों और वर्तमान स्थिति सूचकांक सितंबर में 49.9 के रिकॉर्ड निचले स्तर पर पहुंच गया था।

टिप्पणी:

  • भारतीय उपभोक्ताओं के अनुसार वर्तमान के बारे में अधिक निराशावादी और भविष्य के बारे में कम गूँज, जिससे उन्हें घरेलू खपत से प्रेरित अर्थव्यवस्था में बड़ा खर्च करने की संभावना कम हो गई।
  • भारतीय रिजर्व बैंक के उपभोक्ता विश्वास सर्वेक्षण के अनुसार, वर्तमान स्थिति सूचकांक मार्च में 55.5 से गिरकर 53.1 पर आ गया, जहां 100 निराशावाद और आशावाद के बीच विभाजन रेखा है।
  • सर्वेक्षण के उत्तरदाता भी आने वाले वर्ष के बारे में कम आशावादी थे, भविष्य की उम्मीदों का सूचकांक समीक्षाधीन अवधि में 117.1 से 108.8 तक गिर गया।
  • निराशावाद के कारण सामान्य आर्थिक स्थिति, आय और कीमतों पर बिगड़ती भावनाएँ थीं और वर्तमान स्थिति सूचकांक सितंबर में 49.9 के रिकॉर्ड निचले स्तर पर पहुंच गया था।
  • अच्छी तरह से जमी हुई मुद्रास्फीति की उम्मीदें, जो मौद्रिक नीति निर्माताओं के लिए एक अतिरिक्त चुनौती है, जिन्हें पिछले साल मूल्य वृद्धि में लाभ के कारण ब्याज दरों में कटौती को रोकने के लिए मजबूर किया गया था।
  • जनवरी 2021 के सर्वेक्षण की तुलना में मौजूदा अवधि के साथ-साथ आने वाले तीन महीनों के लिए परिवारों की औसत मुद्रास्फीति धारणा 50 आधार अंकों की वृद्धि के साथ क्रमशः 8.7% और 80 बीपीएस बढ़कर 10.1% हो गई।
  • आने वाले एक साल के लिए मंझला मुद्रास्फीति अनुमान भी ऊंचे स्तर पर बना हुआ है।
  • बढ़ी हुई मुद्रास्फीति और नकारात्मक वास्तविक दरें सोने जैसी भौतिक संपत्तियों में निवेश को प्रोत्साहित करने जैसी अपनी विकृतियां पैदा कर सकती हैं, जो बदले में उच्च सोने के आयात और कम वित्तीय बचत के माध्यम से कम संभावित विकास के माध्यम से बाहरी संतुलन पर दबाव डाल सकती हैं।

quiz.text:
Which of the following bank recently tied up with Star Health and Allied Insurance Company Limited? 
निम्नलिखित में से किस बैंक ने हाल ही में स्टार हेल्थ एंड एलाइड इंश्योरेंस कंपनी लिमिटेड के साथ करार किया है?
options:
(A) South Indian Bank
(A) साउथ इंडियन बैंक

(B) Kerala Gramin Bank
(B) केरल ग्रामीण बैंक

(D) Vallivattom Service Co-operative Bank
(D) वल्लीवट्टोम सर्विस को-ऑपरेटिव बैंक
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Federal Bank.

Key Points

  • Federal Bank partnered with Star Health and Allied Insurance Co Ltd as a corporate agent to provide health insurance products to the bank's customers.
  • The partnership is also known as(a.k.a.) Bancassurance( the partnership of Bank + Insurance so that bank is able to provide insurance services).
  • The partnership was announced on 10th December 2021.
  • The insurance products will be provided to Federal Bank's 8.9 million customers through its 1291 branches spread across the country.

Important Points

  • Federal Bank was established in 1931 and Shyam Srinivasan is the present MD & CEO.
  • Star Health and Allied Insurance Company was established in 2006 and Venkatasamy Jagannathan is the present Chairman.
  • Federal Bank is headquartered in Kochi, Kerala.
  • Star Health and Allied Insurance Co Ltd is headquartered in Chennai, Tamil Nadu.


सही उत्तर ​फेडरल बैंक है। 

Key Points

  • फेडरल बैंक ने बैंक के ग्राहकों को स्वास्थ्य बीमा उत्पाद प्रदान करने के लिए एक कॉर्पोरेट एजेंट के रूप में स्टार हेल्थ एंड एलाइड इंश्योरेंस कंपनी लिमिटेड के साथ भागीदारी की।
  • साझेदारी को (A.K.A.) बैंक एश्योरेंस (बैंक + बीमा की साझेदारी ताकि बैंक बीमा सेवाएं प्रदान करने में सक्षम हो) के रूप में भी जाना जाता है।
  • साझेदारी की घोषणा 10 दिसंबर 2021 को की गई थी।
  • फेडरल बैंक के 8.9 मिलियन ग्राहकों को देश भर में फैली इसकी 1291 शाखाओं के माध्यम से बीमा उत्पाद प्रदान किए जाएंगे।

Important Points

  • फेडरल बैंक की स्थापना 1931 में हुई थी और श्याम श्रीनिवासन वर्तमान प्रबंध निदेशक एवं मुख्य कार्यकारी अधिकारी हैं।
  • स्टार हेल्थ एंड एलाइड इंश्योरेंस कंपनी की स्थापना 2006 में हुई थी और वेंकटसामी जगन्नाथन वर्तमान अध्यक्ष हैं।
  • फेडरल बैंक का मुख्यालय कोच्चि, केरल में है।
  • स्टार हेल्थ एंड एलाइड इंश्योरेंस कंपनी लिमिटेड का मुख्यालय चेन्नई, तमिलनाडु में है।

quiz.text:
Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved Zomato’s request to acquire approximately how much per cent stake in the online grocery platform Grofers India and its wholesale entity Hands on Trades?
भारतीय प्रतिस्पर्धा आयोग (CCI) ने ऑनलाइन किराना प्लेटफॉर्म Grofers India और इसकी थोक इकाई Hands on Trades में लगभग कितनी प्रतिशत हिस्सेदारी हासिल करने हेतु जोमैटो के अनुरोध को मंजूरी दे दी है?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 9.3%.

  • Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved Zomato’s request to invest in the online grocery platform Grofers India and its wholesale entity Hands on Trades. 
  • It will acquire approximately a 9.3% stake in the firms.
  • Zomato is also finalizing a $100 million investment in the e-grocer at a valuation of $1 billion. 
  • Zomato has also relaunched its own grocery marketplace—Zomato Market—starting with Delhi-NCR.
  • In late June, Grofers closed a $120 million investment from Zomato and Tiger Global, valuing it at a little over $1 billion.
  • Tiger Global is an investor in both Zomato and Grofers.


सही उत्तर 9.3% है।

  • भारतीय प्रतिस्पर्धा आयोग (CCI) ने ऑनलाइन किराना प्लेटफॉर्म Grofers India और इसकी थोक इकाई Hands on Trades में निवेश करने हेतु जोमैटो के अनुरोध को मंजूरी दे दी है।
  • यह फर्मों में लगभग 9.3% हिस्सेदारी का अधिग्रहण करेगा।
  • जौमेटो ई-किराने में $1 बिलियन के मूल्यांकन पर $100 मिलियन के निवेश को भी अंतिम रूप दे रहा है।
  • जोमैटो ने दिल्ली-एनसीआर से शुरू करने के साथ अपना खुद का किराना मार्केटप्लेस- Zomato Market- फिर से लॉन्च किया है।
  • जून के अंत में, ग्रोफर्स ने ज़ोमैटो और टाइगर ग्लोबल से $120 मिलियन का निवेश बंद कर दिया, जिसका मूल्य $1 बिलियन से थोड़ा अधिक था।
  • टाइगर ग्लोबल जोमैटो और ग्रोफर्स दोनों में एक निवेशक है।

quiz.text:
FDI limit in the Defence manufacturing under automatic route was be raised to ____ per cent.
स्वचालित मार्ग के तहत रक्षा निर्माण में FDI की सीमा को _____ प्रतिशत तक बढ़ा दिया गया था।
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 74%

Key Points

  • FDI limit in the Defence manufacturing under automatic route will be raised from 49 per cent to 74 per cent.
  • Foreign firms can directly invest up to 74 per cent in the defence sector raising the Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) cap from 49 per cent through the automatic route.
  • However, foreign investments will be subject to scrutiny on grounds of national security and the government will have the right to review any investment that has a bearing on the country's security. 
  • Fresh foreign investment of up to 49 per cent in a company not seeking a new industrial licence or which already has government approval for FDI in defence will also need to be cleared.


सही उत्तर 74% है। 

Key Points

  • स्वचालित मार्ग के तहत रक्षा निर्माण से FDI की सीमा 49 फीसदी से बढ़ाकर 74 फीसदी की जाएगी। 
  • विदेशी कंपनियां स्वचालित मार्ग से प्रत्यक्ष विदेशी निवेश (FDI) की सीमा 49 प्रतिशत से बढ़ाकर रक्षा क्षेत्र में सीधे 74 प्रतिशत तक निवेश कर सकती हैं।
  • हालांकि, विदेशी निवेश राष्ट्रीय सुरक्षा के आधार पर जांच के अधीन होगा और सरकार को देश की सुरक्षा पर असर डालने वाले किसी भी निवेश की समीक्षा करने का अधिकार होगा।
  • नई औद्योगिक लाइसेंस की मांग नहीं करने वाली कंपनी में 49 प्रतिशत तक के नए विदेशी निवेश या रक्षा में FDI के लिए पहले से ही सरकार की मंजूरी की भी आवश्यकता होगी।

quiz.text:
The uniform GST rate on MMF(man-made fibre) products 12% recently announced by the Finance Ministry. What was the previous GST rate on MMF product?
MMF (मानव निर्मित फाइबर) उत्पादों पर एक समान जीएसटी दर 12% हाल ही में वित्त मंत्रालय द्वारा घोषित की गई है। MMF उत्पाद पर पिछली GST दर क्या थी?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 18 per cent.

Key Points

  • The finance ministry has notified a uniform 12 per cent GST rate on manmade fibre (MMF), yarn, fabrics and apparel products.
  • The changed rates will come into effect from 1st January 2022.
  • Previously The GST rate was different on MMF, MMF yarn, and MMF fabrics were 18%, 12%, and 5% respectively.

Additional Information

  • the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) is the body to publish the notification of changes in GST rate, giving effect to the GST Council decision.
  • Chairman & Members of the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) is Shri Vivek Johri (2022)
  • CBIC is the nodal national agency for administering Customs, GST, Central Excise, Service Tax & Narcotics in India.


सही उत्तर 18 प्रतिशत है।

Key Points 

  • वित्त मंत्रालय ने मानव निर्मित फाइबर (MMF), यार्न, कपड़े और परिधान उत्पादों पर एक समान 12 प्रतिशत जीएसटी दर अधिसूचित की है।
  • बदली हुई दरें 1 जनवरी 2022 से प्रभावी होंगी।
  • पहले MMF, MMF यार्न और MMF फैब्रिक पर GST दर अलग-अलग थी, क्रमशः 18%, 12% और 5% थी।

Additional Information 

  • केंद्रीय अप्रत्यक्ष कर और सीमा शुल्क बोर्ड (CBIC) GST परिषद के निर्णय को प्रभावी करते हुए GST दर में परिवर्तन की अधिसूचना प्रकाशित करने वाला निकाय है।
  • केंद्रीय अप्रत्यक्ष कर और सीमा शुल्क बोर्ड (CBIC) के अध्यक्ष और सदस्य श्री विवेक जौहरी (2022) हैं
  • CBIC भारत में सीमा शुल्क, जीएसटी, केंद्रीय उत्पाद शुल्क, सेवा कर और नारकोटिक्स के प्रशासन के लिए नोडल राष्ट्रीय एजेंसी है।

quiz.text:
In 2022, how many public sector banks in India?
2022 में, भारत में कितने सार्वजनिक क्षेत्र के बैंक हैं?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 12.

Key Points

  • The Indian banking system consists of 12 public sector banks, 22 private sector banks, 44 foreign banks, 56 regional rural banks, 1,485 urban cooperative banks, and 96,000 rural cooperative banks in addition to cooperative credit institutions. 
  • India has come down from 27 public sector banks in 2017 to 12 in 2020.
  • Following is the list of 12 public sector banks according to the Department of Financial Services of India :
    • ​Bank of Baroda
    • bank of India
    • bank of Maharashtra
    • Canara bank
    • the central bank of India
    • Indian bank
    • Indian overseas bank
    • Punjab national bank
    • Punjab and Sindh bank
    • Union Bank of India 
    • UCO bank
    • State bank of India


सही उत्तर 12 है। 

Key Points

  • भारतीय बैंकिंग प्रणाली में सहकारी ऋण संस्थानों के अलावा 12 सार्वजनिक क्षेत्र के बैंक, 22 निजी क्षेत्र के बैंक, 44 विदेशी बैंक, 56 क्षेत्रीय ग्रामीण बैंक, 1,485 शहरी सहकारी बैंक और 96,000 ग्रामीण सहकारी बैंक शामिल हैं।
  • भारत 2017 में सार्वजनिक क्षेत्र के 27 बैंकों से घटकर 2020 में 12 हो गया है।
  • भारत के वित्तीय सेवा विभाग के अनुसार सार्वजनिक क्षेत्र के 12 बैंकों की सूची इस प्रकार है:
    • बैंक ऑफ बड़ौदा
    • बैंक ऑफ इंडिया
    • बैंक ऑफ महाराष्ट्र
    • केनरा बैंक
    • सेंट्रल बैंक ऑफ़ इंडिया
    • इंडियन बैंक
    • इंडियन ओवरसीज बैंक
    • पंजाब नेशनल बैंक
    • पंजाब एंड सिंध बैंक
    • यूनियन बैंक ऑफ इंडिया
    • यूको बैंक
    • भारतीय स्टेट बैंक

quiz.text:
In November 2021, RBI introduced an Internal Ombudsman mechanism for select Non-Banking Financial Companies.Non-Deposit-taking NBFCs with assets size of _______must appoint an Internal Ombudsman (IO).
नवंबर 2021 में, RBI ने चुनिंदा गैर-बैंकिंग वित्तीय कंपनियों के लिए एक आंतरिक लोकपाल तंत्र की शुरुआत की। गैर-जमा लेने वाली एनबीएफसी जिनकी संपत्ति आकार _______ है, उन्हें एक आंतरिक लोकपाल (आईओ) नियुक्त करना चाहिए।
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is ₹5,000 crore.

Key Points

  • The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on 15 November 2021 introduced an Internal Ombudsman mechanism for select Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs).
  • Desposit-taking NBFCs with 10 or more branches and non-deposit taking NBFCs with assets size of ₹5,000 crore must appoint an Internal Ombudsman (IO).
  • The RBI has given six months time to follow the directions.

Important Points

  • ​The direction covers the appointment/tenure, role and responsibilities, procedural guidelines, and oversight mechanism for the IO.
  • All complaints that are partly or wholly rejected by the NBFC will be reviewed by the IO before the final decision of the NBFC is conveyed to the complainant.
  • The IO will not entertain any complainants directly from members of public.
  • The implementation of the IO mechanism will be monitored by the NBFC’s internal audit system apart from regulatory oversight by RBI.


सही उत्तर ₹5,000 करोड़ है। 

Key Points

  • भारतीय रिज़र्व बैंक (RBI) ने 15 नवंबर 2021 को चुनिंदा गैर-बैंकिंग वित्तीय कंपनियों (NBFC) के लिए एक आंतरिक लोकपाल तंत्र की शुरुआत की।
  • 10 या अधिक शाखाओं वाली जमाराशि स्वीकार करने वाली NBFC और 5,000 करोड़ रुपये की संपत्ति आकार वाली जमा न लेने वाली NBFC को एक आंतरिक लोकपाल (IO) नियुक्त करना होगा।
  • RBI ​ने निर्देशों का पालन करने के लिए छह महीने का समय दिया है।

Important Points

  • दिशा में IO के लिए नियुक्ति/कार्यकाल, भूमिका और जिम्मेदारियां, प्रक्रियात्मक दिशानिर्देश और निरीक्षण तंत्र शामिल हैं।
  • शिकायतकर्ता को NBFC के अंतिम निर्णय से अवगत कराने से पहले NBFC द्वारा आंशिक या पूर्ण रूप से खारिज की गई सभी शिकायतों की समीक्षा IO द्वारा की जाएगी।
  • IO सीधे जनता के सदस्यों से किसी भी शिकायतकर्ता की बात नहीं सुनेगा।
  • IO तंत्र के कार्यान्वयन की निगरानी RBI द्वारा नियामक निरीक्षण के अलावा NBFC की आंतरिक लेखा परीक्षा प्रणाली द्वारा की जाएगी।

quiz.text:
Read the following passage carefully and answer the following questions:                                  

At one level, colonialism simply means the establishment of rule by one country over another. In the modern period, Western colonialism has had the greatest impact. India’s past has been marked by the entry of numerous groups of people at different times who have established their rule over different parts of what constitutes modern India today. The impact of colonial rule is distinguishable from all other earlier rules because the changes it brought in were far-reaching and deep. History is full of examples of the annexation of foreign territory and the domination of weaker by stronger powers. Nevertheless, there is a vital difference between the empire-building of pre-capitalist times and that of capitalist times. Apart from outright pillage, the pre-capitalist conquerors benefited from their domination by exacting a continuous flow of tribute. On the whole, they did not interfere with the economic base. They simply took the tribute that was skimmed off the economic surplus that was produced traditionally in the subjugated areas.              

For instance, it changed the very laws of the land. (A) Every policy was geared towards the strengthening and expansion of British capitalism. (B) It changed not just land ownership laws but decided even what crops ought to be grown and what ought not to be. (C) In contrast, British colonialism which was based on a capitalist system directly interfered to ensure the greatest profit and benefit to British capitalism. (D) It meddled with the manufacturing sector. It altered the way the production and distribution of goods took place. It entered into the forests. It cleared trees and started tea plantations. It brought in Forest Acts that changed the lives of pastoralists. They were prevented from entering many forests that had earlier provided valuable forage for their cattle. The box carries a brief account of the impact of colonial forest policy in North-East India. 

Colonialism also led to the considerable movement of people. It led to the movement of people from one part to another within India. For instance, people from present-day Jharkhand moved to Assam to work on the tea plantations. A newly emerging middle class particularly from the British Presidency regions of Bengal and Madras moved as government employees and professionals like doctors and lawyers moved to different parts of the country. People were carted in ships from India to work on other colonized lands in distant Asia, Africa, and the Americas. Many died on their way. Most could never return. Today many of their descendants are known as people of Indian origin.

In a passage, a sentence is highlighted, divided into four parts, and jumbled, which when arranged will form a logical and coherent sentence. Rearrange to form a meaningful sentence and choose the option that represents the correct arrangement.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Option 2 DBAC.

Key Points

  • Sentence D is the first sentence: The sentence starts with the word contrast which means different from what is said before, in this case, what is said in the paragraph before.
  • Therefore, 'In contrast, British colonialism which was based on a capitalist system directly interfered to ensure the greatest profit and benefit to British capitalism', is the first sentence.
  • Sentence B is the second sentence: Sentence 1 talks about British capitalism, so the sentence following sentence 1 should refer to British capitalism, therefore sentence B will be the second sentence.
  • Therefore, Every policy was geared towards the strengthening and expansion of British capitalism, is the second sentence.
  • Sentence A is the third sentence: As sentence 2 is talking about the expansion of British capitalism, sentence 3 should talk about the changes that it caused. Therefore sentence A will be the third sentence.
  • Therefore, For instance, it changed the very laws of the land, is the third sentence.
  • Sentence C is the fourth sentence: It is the last sentence that states the changes that British capitalism caused.
  • Therefore, It changed not just land ownership laws but decided even what crops ought to be grown and what ought not to be, is the fourth sentence.

Hence, the correct sequence of sentences is,

'In contrast, British colonialism which was based on a capitalist system directly interfered to ensure the greatest profit and benefit to British capitalism. Every policy was geared towards the strengthening and expansion of British capitalism. For instance, it changed the very laws of the land. It changed not just land ownership laws but decided even what crops ought to be grown and what ought not to be'.

quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Option 4 defeater.

  • The word conqueror means a person who conquers a place or people; a vanquisher.

  • All other words in the option are antonyms of 'conqueror'.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is defeater.

quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Option 2 Understanding Colonialism.

Key Points

  • If we read the passage carefully, we can understand the main idea of the passage.
  • The passage is trying to explain what colonialism really is all over the world.
  • It talks about Indian and British colonialism and changes in it over the period of time.
  • How colonialism affects people and their surroundings.
  • From all this, we can say that the passage is trying to explain colonialism overall
  • Therefore, the correct answer is 'understanding colonialism'.

Fill in the blanks with the most appropriate option based on your reading of the passage.

By using the phrase 'skimmed off' the author wants to say that they took the honor that was __________ from the economic surplus.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Option 2 taken.

Key Points

  • Skimmed off means to take (something valuable) for oneself out of something else.
  • There is a sentence in the passage, in paragraph 1: They simply took the tribute that was skimmed off the economic surplus that was produced traditionally in the subjugated areas.
  • The sentence is trying to say that they took the tribute which was taken from the economic surplus.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is 'taken'.

What is the tone of the passage?
quiz.solution:
The correct option is 2 informative.

Key Points

  • The tone of the passage represents the author's sentiment or attitude towards the subject being discussed. You probably react differently to different people in the same or different situations. You may speak the same sentence in a harsh or polite or sarcastic tone depending upon the context and people. Similarly, Reading Comprehension passage tones vary in different contexts with the same or different subjects.
  • Cynical: Passages are written in a cynical tone reveal the author's view of society being driven purely by self-interest.
  • Commiserating: The author intends to familiarize the reader with the trauma undergone by the sufferers
  • The current passage is stating information about Colonialism over the period of time.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is 'informative'.

People were carted in ships from India to work on other colonized lands in distant Asia, Africa, and the Americas. Many died on their way. Most could never return. Today many of their descendants are known as people of Indian origin.

Choose which sentence is true/false:

Statement I: The impact of colonial rule is distinguishable from all other earlier rules.

Statement II: Because the changes it brought in were limited and shallow.
options: (A) Statement I is true and statement II is false
(B) Statement I is false and statement II is true
(C) Both statement I and II are true
(D) Both statement I and II are false
quiz.solution:
The correct option is 1 ​Statement I is true and statement II is false. 

Key Points

  • There is a statement from the passage, in paragraph 1 -  The impact of colonial rule is distinguishable from all other earlier rules because the changes it brought in were far-reaching and deep.
  • The two statements are taken from this one sentence, while sentence 1 is true but the reason given later is wrong, In the other half of the sentence, it is given that the changes were far-reaching and deep, while in the question, in statement 2 it is given the changes were limited and shallow which is incorrect.
  • Therefore, According to this, Statement I is true and statement II is false.

quiz.text:
Read the following passage carefully and answer the following questions:                                  

At one level, colonialism simply means the establishment of rule by one country over another. In the modern period, Western colonialism has had the greatest impact. India’s past has been marked by the entry of numerous groups of people at different times who have established their rule over different parts of what constitutes modern India today. The impact of colonial rule is distinguishable from all other earlier rules because the changes it brought in were far-reaching and deep. History is full of examples of the annexation of foreign territory and the domination of weaker by stronger powers. Nevertheless, there is a vital difference between the empire-building of pre-capitalist times and that of capitalist times. Apart from outright pillage, the pre-capitalist conquerors benefited from their domination by exacting a continuous flow of tribute. On the whole, they did not interfere with the economic base. They simply took the tribute that was skimmed off the economic surplus that was produced traditionally in the subjugated areas.              

For instance, it changed the very laws of the land. (A) Every policy was geared towards the strengthening and expansion of British capitalism. (B) It changed not just land ownership laws but decided even what crops ought to be grown and what ought not to be. (C) In contrast, British colonialism which was based on a capitalist system directly interfered to ensure the greatest profit and benefit to British capitalism. (D) It meddled with the manufacturing sector. It altered the way the production and distribution of goods took place. It entered into the forests. It cleared trees and started tea plantations. It brought in Forest Acts that changed the lives of pastoralists. They were prevented from entering many forests that had earlier provided valuable forage for their cattle. The box carries a brief account of the impact of colonial forest policy in North-East India. 

Colonialism also led to the considerable movement of people. It led to the movement of people from one part to another within India. For instance, people from present-day Jharkhand moved to Assam to work on the tea plantations. A newly emerging middle class particularly from the British Presidency regions of Bengal and Madras moved as government employees and professionals like doctors and lawyers moved to different parts of the country. People were carted in ships from India to work on other colonized lands in distant Asia, Africa, and the Americas. Many died on their way. Most could never return. Today many of their descendants are known as people of Indian origin.

What is the correct meaning of the word descendants?
options: (A) A person who held a job or office before the current holder.
(B) A person or thing that succeeds another.
(C) A person, plant, or animal that is descended from a particular ancestor.
(D) A person who inherits something; an heir.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Option 3 ​a person, plant, or animal that is descended from a particular ancestor.

 Key Points

  • Descendant is a noun that means a person, plant, or animal that is descended from a particular ancestor.
  • Therefore the correct answer is Option 3.
  • Let's look at other meanings given in the option.
  • Predecessor: a person who held a job or office before the current holder
  • Successor: a person or thing that succeeds another.
  • heritor: a person who inherits something; an heir.

quiz.text:
Read the passage given below and then answer the questions given below the passage. Some words may be highlighted for your attention. Pay careful attention.

Australia, which is globally the fifth largest exporter of cotton, is looking at India to emerge as a consistent and major buyer of its commodity. An eight-member delegation representing the Australian Cotton Shippers’ Association held meetings in Ludhiana, Mumbai, and Coimbatore between February 27 and March 3. “We came to promote and enhance use of Australian cotton,” Matthew Bradd, chairman of Australian Cotton Shippers’ Association, told The Hindu here on Thursday. “We want India to become a consistent buyer of our cotton.” Australia has nearly 1,200 cotton growers and can supply even small quantities of cotton to India. China purchased over 30% of Australia’s cotton production last year. However, this was lower than its usual purchase.“India is a big market for cotton and spinners in India said they have had good experience with Australian cotton,” he said. According to Hamish McIntyre, vice-chairman of Cotton Australia and a member of the eight-member delegation, India used to purchase 5% to 7% of cotton produced in Australia every year. In 2016, it shot up to nearly 23%. This was mainly because of the drop in production in India last year. Indian textile mills can use Australian cotton as a blend to produce high value garments. The area under cotton and production was increasing in Australia, he said. K.N. Viswanathan, vice-president of Indian Cotton Federation, said that Australia cotton is known for its quality and strength. However, its production was limited until last year.India is the largest producer and consumer of cotton globally. But, India’s imports are also more to meet the need for long staple cotton. For Indian spinners, with failure of monsoon in many places this year where long staple cotton is grown, Australian cotton can be an option. At present, Australian cotton and Indian cotton prices seem to be almost at par. The Indian cotton industry faced a number of problems. Most of them did not have managerial leadership and technical knowledge except the financial capability so had to face the chill wind almost constantly. The result was the frequent changes of managing agents and liquidation of the companies on the one hand, and the oligarchic concentration of the mills to a few agency firms on the other hand. The Indian cotton textile industry had to face stiff competition from Britain’s most internationally aggressive cotton industry. And, in the process, British industry suffered a lot at the hands of the Indian industry. But some events of the 1920s eroded the competitiveness of the Indian industry. After the end of the World War I, Japanese exports of cloth to India acted as a big threat to the Indian industry though such Japanese exports were held in check in the 1920s. But it reappeared after 1930 despite a high tariff rate of 50 p.c. Most of the labourers of the cotton mills were unsophisticated in the sense that they were recruited from the small peasants and agricultural labourers. As a result, permanent textile labour force could not arise. Textile machinery and technology used in this industry were imported before the World War I and it continued till the outbreak of the World War II. However, India could not procure modern equipments from America and Japan because technology of the cotton textile industry was heavily Manchester-biased.

What is the central idea of the passage?
options: (A) Problems of the Indian cotton industry.
(B) The competitiveness of the Indian cotton industry.
(C) Australia's eagerness to make a stable position for its cotton industry in the Indian market.
(D) Competition of China and India as the importer of cotton.
(E) Need for India to import cotton from Australia.
quiz.solution: The passage focuses on Australia's inclination to make a position in the Indian market. It wants India to be a more stable importer of cotton. Thus option 3 is the correct answer.

What makes the Australian variant of cotton so popular?
options: (A) The Australian variety is much cheaper than Indian cotton.
(B) Australian cotton is known for its strength and quality
(C) Majority of the people of India are involved in the cotton industry.
(D) Technology has played a big role in making it popular.
(E) The stability of the Australian cotton industry makes it popular.
quiz.solution: it is mentioned in the passage that K.N. Viswanathan, vice-president of Indian Cotton Federation stated that Australia cotton is known for its quality and strength.Thus option 2 is the correct answer.

Is there any possibility of the Indian cotton industry getting benefited by the Australian cotton industry? If yes, how?
options: (A) The Indian cotton industry can benefit only if the tariffs are kept low.
(B) Indian cotton can be blended with the Australian cotton to produce higher quality garments.
(C) The problems faced from the labour force can be reduced if the dependence of the cotton industry increases on Australia.
(D) The Indian cotton industry can get seriously hampered as both the cotton are of the same quality.
(E) There is competition between the two countries and none can benefit from each other.
quiz.solution: According to the first paragraph of the passage, 'Indian textile mills can use Australian cotton as a blend to produce high value garments.' There can definitely be an advantage if the two countries can mix and work on cotton industries. Since the cost of Australian cotton is at par with Indian cotton, so India can benefit by working with Australia. Thus, option 2 is the correct answer.

quiz.text:
In the following question, two columns are given containing three phrases each. In the first column phrases are A, B, and C and in the second column, the phrases are D, E, and F. A phrase from the first column may or may not connect with phrase from the second column to make grammatically and contextually correct sentence. There are five options, four of which display the sequence(s) in which the phrases can be joined to form a grammatically and contextually correct sentence. If none of the options forms a correct sentence after combination, select ‘None of these’ as your answer.

Column 1

Column 2

A. ‘OxyContin’ maker Purdue Pharma LP won court approval of a $4.5 billion bankruptcy settlement that shields its owners from

D. gross electricity production of about 24% is far higher than those of all other renewable energy sources. 

B. The latest GDP estimates expectedly show that the national output rebounded in the first quarter of the current fiscal from the

E. record contraction in April-June 2020 when the pandemic’s onset and the lockdown gutted the economy.

C. Wind energy is of outstanding importance to the energy transition in Germany, and its share in

F. lawsuits accusing them of contributing to the nation’s opioid epidemic in exchange for providing funding to combat the crisis.
options: (A) A - F, B - E, C - D
(C) A - E, B - F, C - D
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is A - F, B - E, C - D.

Key Points 

  • There are three combinations from the given phrases that make meaningful sentences.
  • Parts A and F connect grammatically and contextually. Part A states “‘OxyContin’ maker Purdue Pharma LP won court approval of a $4.5 billion bankruptcy settlement that shields its owners from” which is connected with Part F i.e. ‘lawsuits accusing them of contributing to the nation’s opioid epidemic in exchange for providing funding to combat the crisis’.
    • Part A talks about the bankruptcy settlement won by Purdue Pharma that ‘shields’ its owners. Also, the word ‘from’ helps in choosing the next part. Part F mentions ‘lawsuits’. Hence, we can infer that the bankruptcy settlement ‘shields’ owners from ‘lawsuits’ accusing them. Thus, A - F is the correct combination.
  • Parts B and E connect grammatically and contextually​. Part B states ‘The latest GDP estimates expectedly show that the national output rebounded in the first quarter of the current fiscal from the’ which is connected with Part E i.e. ‘record contraction in April-June 2020 when the pandemic’s onset and the lockdown gutted the economy’.
    • While Part B says that the national output ‘rebounded’ in the first quarter as expected, part E mentions ‘record contraction’ in the previous year. The usage ‘rebounded’ indicates recovery from a setback and this setback is the ‘contraction’ in the previous year. Thus, B - E is the correct combination.
  • Parts C and D connect grammatically and contextually​. Parts C states ‘Wind energy is of outstanding importance to the energy transition in Germany, and its share in’ which is connected with Part D i.e. ‘gross electricity production of about 24% is far higher than those of all other renewable energy sources’.
    • The phrase ‘its share in total’ given in part C should be followed by a larger unit/total. Part D mentions ‘gross electricity production’ which is a production total. Besides, it is obvious that wind energy contributes to electricity production and has a certain share in the gross production value. Thus, C - D is the correct combination.

The correct sentences will be:

  • ‘OxyContin’ maker Purdue Pharma LP won court approval of a $4.5 billion bankruptcy settlement that shields its owners from lawsuits accusing them of contributing to the nation’s opioid epidemic in exchange for providing funding to combat the crisis.
  • The latest GDP estimates expectedly show that the national output rebounded in the first quarter of the current fiscal from the record contraction in April-June 2020 when the pandemic’s onset and the lockdown gutted the economy.
  • Wind energy is of outstanding importance to the energy transition in Germany, and its share in gross electricity production of about 24% is far higher than those of all other renewable energy sources.

quiz.text:
In the following question, two columns are given containing three phrases each. In the first column phrases are A, B, and C and in the second column, the phrases are D, E, and F. A phrase from the first column may or may not connect with a phrase from the second column to make grammatically and contextually correct sentence. There are five options, four of which display the sequence(s) in which the phrases can be joined to form a grammatically and contextually correct sentence. If none of the options forms a correct sentence after combination, select ‘None of these as your answer.

Column 1

Column 2

A. The ensuing wave of travel bans has cut off UK travellers

D. a relatively clean source of fossil energy has soared by more than 50% over the past two decades.

B. Harrison’s project is the world’s first field trial of marine cloud brightening, one of

E. but flight trials of its aircraft complement are expected to be completed, after which the ship
will be fully operational.

C. Methane is the main component of natural gas, whose popularity as

F. Several controversial geoengineering technologies that scientists have studied in the laboratory for decades.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is B - F, C - D.

Key Points 

  • There are two combinations from the given phrases that make meaningful sentences.
  • Part B and F connect grammatically and contextually. Part B states ‘Harrison’s project is the world’s first field trial of marine cloud brightening, one of’ which is connected with Part F i.e. ‘several controversial geoengineering technologies that scientists have studied in the laboratory for decades’.
    • ​Part B mentions the first field trial of ‘marine cloud brightening’. Part F mentions ‘one of the controversial geoengineering technologies’. We can infer that F part talks about the marine cloud brightening technology. Thus, B - F is the correct combination.
  • Parts C and D connect grammatically and contextually. Part C states ‘Methane is the main component of natural gas, whose popularity as’ which is connected with Part D i.e.’a relatively clean source of fossil energy has soared by more than 50% over the past two decades’.
    • ​Part C talks about ‘Natural gas’. Part D talks about a relatively clean source of fossil energy, and this is contextually related to natural gas which has become popular. The two parts connect grammatically as well. Thus, C - D is the correct combination.

The correct sentences will be:

  • Harrison’s project is the world’s first field trial of marine cloud brightening, one of several controversial geoengineering technologies that scientists have studied in the laboratory for decades.
  • Methane is the main component of natural gas, whose popularity as a relatively clean source of fossil energy has soared by more than 50% over the past two decades.

quiz.text:
Direction: Given below is a passage with five blanks (A-E). A phrase written in brackets is given against each blank. Choose the right word from the options which can replace the phrase most appropriately. If none of the options are fit for replacement, according to you, then select ‘None of these' as your answer.

India’s Economic growth has slowed for 5 _______(A) (that follow one after another) quarters beginning from late 2015-16 onwards. It could be a serious blow for a government that had promised to turn around the economy through ________(B) (capable of making choices quickly and surely) governance. India’s GDP growth has gone down from a high of 9.2% in the Third Quarter of the year 2016 to 5.7% in the current 4thquarter of 2017. The economic growth rate is probably the slowest in the last many years. However, the Indian Economy as per global standard is not in the _______(C) (slowdown or a massive contraction) stage. The UK and the European Union consider an economy in recession only when real GDP growth actually turns negative over two consecutive quarters and by this criterion, with a positive growth rate of 5.7%, the Indian economy is far off from being in a recession. All four contributors to economic growth – domestic consumption, foreign consumption or exports, private investment and government spending – are hit by the slowdown. In the first quarter of this ______ (D) (connected with [public] money) year, domestic consumption fell to 6.66% as against 8.41% in the same period last fiscal; exports as a share of the Gross Domestic Product was down to 19% from 20%; and fixed capital formation decreased from about 31% of the GDP to 29.8%, _______(E) (to convey something) a slowdown in the industry as well.

Which of the following fits the blank labelled (A)?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is consecutive.

Key Points

  • The given passage is about India's economic slowdown. 
  • Let us refer to the line from the passage, "India’s Economic growth has slowed for 5 _______(A) (that follow one after another) quarters beginning from late 2015-16 onwards". 
  • From the given line we get to know that from 2015 onwards India's economic growth has slowed down for 5 continuous quarters. 
  • In option 2, the word consecutive means following each other continuously.
  • So,  'consecutive​' is the correct option.


Additional Information

Let us see the meanings of other options:

Other words Meanings
distinct recognizably different in nature from something else of a similar type.
disparate essentially different in kind; not able to be compared.
respective belonging or relating separately to each of two or more people or things.

The correct answer is decisive.

Key Points

  • Let us refer to the line from the passage, "It could be a serious blow for a government that had promised to turn around the economy through _______(B) (making choices quickly and surely) governance". 
  • From the given line we get to know that India's economy going down is a serious blow for a government that had promised to turn around the economy with its impressive decision making governance. 
  • In option 4, the word decisive means having or showing the ability to make decisions quickly and effectively. 
  • So,  'decisive​' is the correct option.


Additional Information

Other words Meanings
hitched to move (something) into a different position with a jerk.

In the first quarter of this ______ (D) (connected with [public] money) year, domestic consumption fell to 6.66% as against 8.41% in the same period last fiscal; exports as a share of the Gross Domestic Product was down to 19% from 20%; and fixed capital formation decreased from about 31% of the GDP to 29.8%, _______(E) (to convey something) a slowdown in the industry as well.

Which of the following fits the blank labelled (C)?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is recessionary.

Key Points

  • The given passage is about India's economic slowdown. 
  • Let us refer to the line from the passage, "The economic growth rate is probably the slowest in the last many years. However, the Indian Economy as per global standard is not in the _______(C) (slowdown or a massive contraction) stage".
  • From the given line we get to know that even though economic growth is slowest in these last years, the Indian Economy as per the global standard has not yet reached its lowest economic stage.  
  • In option 1, the word recessionary relates to a period, usually at least six months, of low economic activity, when investments lose value, businesses fail, and people lose their jobs.
  • So,  'recessionary​' is the correct option.


Additional Information

Let us see the meanings of other options:

Other words Meanings
peripheral happening at the edge of something
resurgence an increase or revival after a period of little activity, popularity, or occurrence.
marshal an officer of the highest rank in the armed forces of some countries.

quiz.text:
Direction: Given below is a passage with five blanks (A-E). A phrase written in brackets is given against each blank. Choose the right word from the options which can replace the phrase most appropriately. If none of the options are fit for replacement, according to you, then select ‘None of these' as your answer.

India’s Economic growth has slowed for 5 _______(A) (that follow one after another) quarters beginning from late 2015-16 onwards. It could be a serious blow for a government that had promised to turn around the economy through ________(B) (capable of making choices quickly and surely) governance. India’s GDP growth has gone down from a high of 9.2% in the Third Quarter of the year 2016 to 5.7% in the current 4thquarter of 2017. The economic growth rate is probably the slowest in the last many years. However, the Indian Economy as per global standard is not in the _______(C) (slowdown or a massive contraction) stage. The UK and the European Union consider an economy in recession only when real GDP growth actually turns negative over two consecutive quarters and by this criterion, with a positive growth rate of 5.7%, the Indian economy is far off from being in a recession. All four contributors to economic growth – domestic consumption, foreign consumption or exports, private investment and government spending – are hit by the slowdown. In the first quarter of this ______ (D) (connected with [public] money) year, domestic consumption fell to 6.66% as against 8.41% in the same period last fiscal; exports as a share of the Gross Domestic Product was down to 19% from 20%; and fixed capital formation decreased from about 31% of the GDP to 29.8%, _______(E) (to convey something) a slowdown in the industry as well.

Which of the following fits the blank labelled (D)?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is fiscal.

  • The given passage is about India's economic slowdown. 
  • Let us refer to the line from the passage, "In the first quarter of this _______ (D) connected with (public) money year, domestic consumption fell to 6.66% as against 8.41% in the same period last fiscal"

  • So,  'fiscal​' is the correct option.


Additional Information

Let us see the meanings of other options:

Other words Meanings
rebound bounce back through the air after hitting something hard.

quiz.text:
Directions: Five sentences A, B, C, D, and E are given below, among which only three have been arranged in sequence and two sentences must be interchanged so that the five sentences can together form a meaningful paragraph.

A. Miss Universe is an annual international beauty pageant that is run by the United States-based Miss Universe Organization.

B. Telemundo has the licensing rights to air the pageant for the next 5 years.

C. The Miss Universe Organization and its brand are currently owned by Endeavor.

D. Along with Miss World, Miss International, and Miss Earth, Miss Universe is one of the Big Four international beauty pageants.

E. The pageant's advocacy is humanitarian issues and is a voice to affect positive change in the world.

Which of the following pairs of sentences must be interchanged in order to make the set of sentences a meaningful paragraph?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'B and D.'

Key Points

  • The correct sequence of the segments after rearrangement is ADCBE.
    • The sentence 'A' is independent of any other sentence as it is giving general information about "Miss Universe". Hence, 'A' is the first part.
    • Sentence D should come after A as it further gives information about how important or how big is the Miss Universe event.
    • Sentence C will come after D as it is giving information about who owns the Miss Universe Organization and its brand.
    • Sentence B should come after C as it is giving information about the television broadcast partner of the pageant for the next 5 years.
    • The sentence 'E' is the concluding part because it is talking about the aim and concept of the Miss Universe event.
  • The information given in the sentence 'D' is introducing a subject and is more important than the information given in the sentence 'B'. Therefore, B and D should be interchanged.
     

Hence, the correct answer is option 2.

quiz.text:
Directions: Five sentences A, B, C, D, and E are given below, among which only three have been arranged in sequence and two sentences must be interchanged so that the five sentences can together form a meaningful paragraph.

A. Miss Universe is an annual international beauty pageant that is run by the United States-based Miss Universe Organization.

B. Telemundo has the licensing rights to air the pageant for the next 5 years.

C. The Miss Universe Organization and its brand are currently owned by Endeavor.

D. Along with Miss World, Miss International, and Miss Earth, Miss Universe is one of the Big Four international beauty pageants.

E. The pageant's advocacy is humanitarian issues and is a voice to affect positive change in the world.

After forming a meaningful paragraph, which of the sentences can immediately follow B:

I. The reselling of the franchise from one owner to the next is recurrently common in the history of the event, sometimes for contractual breaches or financial reasons.

II. It is one of the most-watched pageants in the world with an estimated audience of over 500 million viewers in over 190 territories.

III. The fee includes the rights of image, brand, and everything related to the pageant.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Only II.'

Key Points

  • Sentence B is giving information about the television broadcast partner of the pageant for the next 5 years.
  • The next sentence which should follow the sentence 'B' should be related to television or the pageants being televised or being watched.
  • From the given options, only the second option can immediately follow sentence B.
  • The second option is talking about the pageants being watched by a huge audience.
  • The first option is talking about the reselling of the franchise which organizes the Miss Universe event.
  • The third option is talking about some fees related to the pageant.
     

Hence, the correct answer is option 1.

quiz.text:
Directions: Five sentences A, B, C, D, and E are given below, among which only three have been arranged in sequence and two sentences must be interchanged so that the five sentences can together form a meaningful paragraph.

A. Miss Universe is an annual international beauty pageant that is run by the United States-based Miss Universe Organization.

B. Telemundo has the licensing rights to air the pageant for the next 5 years.

C. The Miss Universe Organization and its brand are currently owned by Endeavor.

D. Along with Miss World, Miss International, and Miss Earth, Miss Universe is one of the Big Four international beauty pageants.

After forming a meaningful paragraph, which of the sentences can immediately follow E:

I. This crown was purely made from rhinestones.

II. The crown is set with 1,371 gemstones, weighing a total of 416.09 carats (83.218 g).

III. The current Miss Universe is Harnaaz Sandhu of India who was crowned by Andrea Meza of Mexico on December 12, 2021, in Eilat, Israel.
quiz.solution:

Key Points

  • Sentence E is talking about the aim and concept of the Miss Universe event.
  • The next sentence which should follow the sentence 'E' should be related to Miss Universe only.
  • From the given options, only the third option can immediately follow sentence E.
  • The third option is giving information about the current Miss Universe.
